title: Stepstowealth
author: Stepstowealth
content: Can someone tell me a reason why newbies are not granted access to reply some topics in some places here. For instance, I saw a topic in "serious discussion" side that I would have loved to add some talk to the discussion, but I noticed that although I could read it, there was no option for me to reply. I checked another topic on the same place, and I could not reply still. Then I tried another place to see that I could reply, can someone please explain to me so I can learn, learning is my earnest desire.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: This decision was made around five years ago to decrease spam on "Serious discussion" and its child board "Ivory Tower". For more information, read the post made by theymos.Quote from: theymos on January 10, 2018, 05:12:05 PMI see that newbies were already posting junk in Serious Discussion, so I made changes:Â - The member limitations are moved up one rank. You must be a Jr Member to post in Serious Discussion and a Full Member to post in Ivory TowerÂ - Posts in Serious Discussion only activate a potential-activity period. They do not increase your post count.Â - Posts in Ivory Tower neither activate a potential-activity period nor increase your post count.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Yeah, there are restrictions on certain boards but in all honesty, those aren't related to bitcoin or crypto anyway. You aren't going to learn anything bitcoin-related by browsing and posting in Serious Discussion or the Ivory Tower. You are welcome to participate in the discussions in all sub-boards that mean something though.

I checked another topic on the same place, and I could not reply still. Then I tried another place to see that I could reply, can someone please explain to me so I can learn, learning is my earnest desire. That's rightâ€”newbies aren't allowed to respond to threads. Â Due to the rank "newbie," some users may post replies that are off-topic or even irrelevant because, as the name suggests, we're relatively new to the forum and haven't learned much. Many of us haven't even read the rules, so we may spam or plagiarise. In order to prevent negative trustÂ  and getting banned, users may choose to lock the thread. It's a component of keeping us safe and shielding us from tragedies like these. Additionally, there are some that aren't important enough for you to research or learn.
